document.heading: Excepted and Executive Service Domicile Requirement Amendment Act of 2002

history.narrative: Law 14-185, the “Excepted and Executive Service Domicile Requirement Amendment Act of 2002”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-592, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 2002, and June 4, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 21, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-387 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-185 became effective on October 1, 2002.
